Key Match Events: Anrich Nortje took 4 for 7, his career-best figures, in the match.
Ottneil Baartman took his first wicket with his first ball in a World Cup.
Dasun Shanaka and Aiden Markram faced off in the third over of South Africa's innings, with Mathews controlling the exchange.
Post-Match Reflections: Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller took South Africa home with 22 balls to spare.
Sri Lanka's batters struggled on the tricky pitch, with only three getting into double digits.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The surface is tricky to bat on, with inconsistent bounce and big square boundaries.
Only three Sri Lankan batters got into double figures, and only one partnership was worth more than 20 runs.
127 out of the 214 balls faced by the batters in this game were dots, the most dots in a Men's T20 World Cup game.
